Reviews.Title: “Good location near the campus.”
Reviews.Author: GlenJMart
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms at a Very reasonable price, Has decent wifi and HBO. Only stayed on night but felt like we made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: trippergirl101
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious. I like having a chair with an ottoman near the window. The University is literaly mintues away, great location. There was a convention one of the of the days we were there and the ample parking dwindeled down considerably, the only slight downside, something to think about. We had breakfast at the lobby restaurant which was very good. The servicers were friendly and attentive. They should have better coffee in the room, I wasnt impressed, no offense Wolfgang Puck. The room and halways were very clean and light well. You can see they take care of the hotel. The lobby was exquisitly homey. The pool was small but warm and clean. The whirpool was equally pleasent. They didnt have the "best" work out room: free weights, ~5 treadmills, 1 (old) elliptical, and a few ramdom weight machines, so i didnt use it. All in all a great place to stay. OH the best part was the laundry room on our floor, the 4th. They kept it clean, and they were obviously new machines, yeah! You need Quaters for soap, wash and dryer. $1 each, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, Cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: RipplesGuy
Reviews.Content: For travelers visiting University of Illinois or attending meetings at the adjacent conference/meeting facility, this is a comfortable, brand-standard property. There is a local pizza place, "Monical's" as well as an asian restaurant, McDonald's, and Subway all immediately nearby and several more restaurants less than a block away. The Walgreens adjacent to the hotel's parking lot was also very convenient. I found the staff to be very friendly and the gals in the restaurant at breakfast were especially cheerful. I am normally very sensitive to noise and there are train tracks that run parallel to Neil Street; however the 3-4 trains that I was aware of did not blow their whistles and came through fairly quickly.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Ganilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while on a trip to Champaign for a UI basketball game, based on Trip Advisor recommendations and were pleased. Clean, with very comfortable beds and nice bed linens. Within a comfortable walking distance to several restaurants, including the "Ribeye", pizza, TGI Friday, Hooters and others. Also a comfortable walk to sports venues on campus...maybe not so much if it's a cold, wintery day but walking from the hotel where we parked for free was way better than fighting traffic! The pool and work out facilities were clean. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel and found both good food and good service. The lobby area was very nice and front desk personnel helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good but a bit noisy, uneven service”
Reviews.Author: travelreluctant
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in this hotel within a month. I chose it again because of the location and availablity. The hotel is adequate, but the service may sometimes be on a brusque side. Most annoying, however, are the noises in the night (although it may not be a problem if you are, unlike me, a very sound sleeper). The refrigerator in the room kicks up for a few minutes from time to time, one can hear water running in the neighbouring rooms, and there were also some noises I could not identify the source of. The hotel maids are not supposed to knock on your door for cleaning on the morning of your check-out, but they did and woke us up (on the other hand, we should have remembered to put up a don't disturb sign). They are also a bit too economic with the toiletteries in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bblumberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while visiting UIUC. The room was comfortable and the internet fast enough. I was not amused to find that there was no room service for breakfast since I was on a tight deadline. Other than that, the breakfast was good - much better than at another Hilton Garden Inn I stayed at the following week. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SAHM88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for the purpose of visiting UIUC. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient at completing hotel check-in. As there was no one else going to the airport prior to our meeting, the hotel shuttle drove my colleagues and I to the university; it also drove us back to the hotel from the university after our meeting. This was indeed a pleasant experience! My room was spacious, very clean, and equipped with free WIFI (another plus considering most hotels charge for this internet access). The room was rather cold at the beginning (similar feedback from another colleague) but once I set the thermostat to 'heat' mode, the temperature in the room was acceptable. As to the minor negatives, I was certainly aware whenever the guest(s) in the adjacent room showered. However this seemed to be a common problem also at some of the higher-end U.S. hotels that I had stayed in. Also, the breakfast selection was not great. In summary, I found it comfortable enough and value-for-money for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Ooga_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding and as a result did not spend much time at the hotel. Room was very big and nice with fridge and microwave. The minor negatives to this place was the explosive sound of the flushing toilet in room along with those around ours and the cheap, thin bedspread. The place was clean and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A FULL service Hilton Garden”
Reviews.Author: Swanbirds
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel for a wedding I was performing in Champaign. I usually associate the "garden" brand of Hilton to be the less (or no) frills version that competes with the other budget hotel chains. I was very pleasantly surprised by this lovely hotel. Rooms were spacious, very clean, and equipped with free WIFI. Bedding was luscious and comfortable. The hotel itself was full-service. But the best parts of the hotel were amenities you only associate with larger places....and with attached fees! There was a fully equipped office center with two PCs, printer/scanner and all sorts of desk supplies. The center was free to guests....including unlimited printing on hotel supplied paper! As the bride made several changes at the Friday evening rehearsal, it was such a gift to be able to incorporate those changes and print up new documents Saturday morning. As well, the hotel has a restaurant, which we were not expecting. The menu for breakfast and lunch is limited, but the hot food selections were delicious and very filling. When we returned Saturday afternoon after the wedding ceremony, the little restaurant was transformed into a lounge with bartender. Lovely little spot to sit and grab a drink or glass of wine. The seating was comfortable and welcomed groups, just like you would expect in a larger hotel's lounge/lobby. The wedding reception was held at the Garden Inn as well, and the banquet facilities were well thought out. Parking for guests was separate from hotel guest parking, and there was a direct entrance to the banquet wing. Food was well prepared, and well served. I would definitely stay here again, and was thrilled to find out this matched my expectations for a Hilton Hotel, as opposed to their Garden brand line. (We did not use the pool or exercise facilities...but they looked lovely and were on the first floor with a nice patio area.)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hilton Garden Inn Champaign/Urbana”
Reviews.Author: Bigperm86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party. Hotel room was very clean, and they provided us with two rollaway beds at no extra charge. Also brought one of the beds in at 4am! Gumby's less than a block away. Walgreens right next door. Very positive experience and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding=Success!”
Reviews.Author: dewalsh
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here, and Danielle was incredible in assisting our every need. After a year of planning, our day went on without a hitch. Our banquet room was upgraded to a larger one for free, the gift they gave us was awesome, and the food was delicious. Our guests were able to reserve rooms at a discounted rate, and they were all very impressed as well. Our actual room was very nice as well. It had plenty of room for people to store things in. Multiple people were able to fit in one room to get ready for festivities. Overall, this hotel is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ThaBallr10
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with our stay there last year. Very clean and comfortable. Nice rooms, pool, and gym. A cab or car.is required to get to main campus areas but is within walking distance to memorial stadium and assembly hall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to campus”
Reviews.Author: HaveSuitcaseWillTrvl
Reviews.Content: Champaign's Hilton Garden Inn is a decent business class hotel. Staff are courteous. Although the gym is small, it is well equipped. The proximity to campus is good if you are in town for a football or basketball game. There are no great hotels in CU, however, the Hilton Garden Inn is head and shoulders above other hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loopbay
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on a driving trip to the Midwest (and did the same two years ago). It's not all that convenient to the Interstate, but worth driving a few miles for a good night's sleep. There is a park a block from the hotel which is a good place to get some exercise after a long day's drive as well as a nice residential neighborhood for taking a walk. The hotel restaurant is adequate for dinner and breakfast if one doesn't want to leave the property to eat. The bed was excellent and the room and bath were very clean. The only complaint was the fan which was a bit noisy, but if it was turned off the room could get a little stuffy. The small business center has a computer for guests to use. I'd happily return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: teds300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night while attending a reunion. Well-located for I-Hotel functions, Assembly Hall and Stadium. Front desk staff cordial and welcoming. The room was pleasant, if a little small, with an excellent bed and very nice bath. Amenities in room were good including high-end toiletries, nice bedding, fridge and coffee maker. Wireless internet worked very well. Housekeeping disturbed us at 9:00am despite sign on door. Not a good thing. Only other complaint is that the toilets in this hotel are the pressure flush style and and are quite noisy and can be heard from other rooms as well. Overall, a good stay if a bit pricey at $122 (incl. tax) for a short one-night stay in a fairly average room. Recommended, but try for a better rate when reserving.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: For Champaign, may be upscale. I found the room to be nice sized with free internet access. For longer stays, nice to have a small fridge and microwave. I also enjoyed that our room did not have a bathtub (don't need to step in and out nor was there a shower curtain). But, noise from the hall seeped into the room, dark room (poor lighting and small windows). Could hear toilers flushing from other rooms. I am not a light sleeper by any means but the noises are distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: triplover555
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and staff in so great! Could not have been nicer! Free breakfast mad e to order for gold members!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business. I've stayed here 3 times in the past year and recommend it over any other hotels in Champaign-Urbana. The bedding is wonderful, rooms are clean, staff is frienly. But most of all, it is SILENT in the rooms. I cannot hear any outside noise (neither street nore hallway). When I drove into the hotel's parking lot I saw a bus and thought "Oh great, a team." Well, it was a sports team...but I never heard anybody! In addition, there is a bar/restaurant that's perfect if you need to host a client or colleague.

Reviews.Title: “liked the cookies”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one night in December when we came down for a U of I basketball game. The hotel is within eyeshot of assembly hall, but not walking distance (at least not with two kids in the middle of winter). In contrast there are several restaurants just a short walk away (e.g. Fridays, Hooters, a pizza place). The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The cookies at night were a nice touch. We didn't experience any of the noise issues mentioned by other reviewers. Indeed, our only complaint was that the indoor temperature of the pool area felt cooler than that of the lobby. Lastly, the free wireless internet and a $99/night room rate made for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here not as pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Trav_Junkie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel once before (two years ago), but our second stay was not as pleasant as the first. I'll start with the cons, but end on the good stuff. First, after our first night there our room was not cleaned. We were out of our room from 11am til 6pm and when we returned at 6pm it was just as we left it. We talked to the staff at the front desk and they were not very apologetic or willing to do much about it - they failed the true test of customer service. We had to leave to go to dinner and they told us they would send somebody up to replace the towels and leave some toilet paper. When we returned at 11pm they had not done so. Two strikes. Second, we found bugs nesting in the window of our room. They were friendly lady bugs, and they were harmless, but it didn't make us feel like we had a clean room. Third and last complaint are the thin walls and noise in this hotel. We could hear noise in nearly all directions and since it was a fairly busy weekend with the IHSA football tournament, we could hear a lot of noise. Despite the problems mentioned above (and I do have high standards) this hotel is generally pretty nice. The overall cleanliness is high and since the hotel is only a few years old, it is still in nice condition. The room we had was mid-sized and they have pretty comfortable beds and a nice flat-panel TV. Free wireless internet is nice and it works well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Champaing/Urbana”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the university and stayed here for just 1 night as they were sold out for the rest of my time in Champaign/Urbana. This is either a really new hotel or newly refurbished. The staff are nice and helpful. The setup of the hotel is typical of other Hilton Garden Inns, but there are meeting rooms on the ground floor. The hotel lobby is the nicest I've seen for any Hilton Garden Inn. The rooms are typical, but also very nice. The breakfast was satisfactory. I discovered that they have an airport shuttle, but I don't think that it is advertised on the hotel's website. This hotel is much nicer than the Hampton Inn, but it is not as close to the central part of campus. I would stay here over any other place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the law school. To be honest, I found Champaign kind of depressing, and the thought of staying in a chain hotel didn't help. But there were some good things about this one. First, it looks like it was recently refurbished, so everything was clean. (A faint smell of cigarette smoke, but I've come to expect that in chain hotels, even when they claim to be non-smoking.) My room had two double beds, and they were both comfortable. The room had a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker, and you could even buy frozen food downstairs for the microwave. The bathroom was well stocked with Neutragena products. Breakfast wasn't bad, with the highlight being the made-to-order omelettes. All of the waitstaff, including the woman tending bar and the guy who brought my room service order, were friendly, helpful, and prompt. The food prices were all very reasonable; even with a nearly 20 percent gratuity plus a $2 service charge, room service didn't break the bank at all. The hotel has a shuttle service to and from the airport, which was very handy, as I didn't see a single taxi the entire time I was in Champaign (and that included the airport!) I also used the business center to check my e-mail. They don't charge you for this the way some other hotels do. There's wi-fi throughout the hotel, but I didn't bring my laptop so can't tell you whether this worked well or not. All in all, I had a comfortable stay here.

Reviews.Title: “hilton champaign”
Reviews.Author: jmwb
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay near UIUC campus, but luckily all was full in that area due to a festival so next choice was a hotel in town. Checkin staff were very helpful, first by phone, then when I arrived. Night duty staff dining area attendants also helpful and attentive. The breakfast buffet seems to be a a rarity in USA: the food is actually not bad! Area is quiet, but lots of eateries/shops in the rare case you can't get what you want at the hotel (they provide just about everything). Large comfortable room with free and fast wireless access and printing. What else to want?

Reviews.Title: “Great bed!”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this property, and had a large room on the top floor. I had a "sleep number" bed, and it was wonderful! The room was very clean (except for a stocking in the corner that the maid missed). Also, I received 2 waters upon check-in (may be because I'm an HHonors member). One of the best properties I've stayed at in a while. One negative, the front desk clerk announced my room number even though it was written down for me (and I wasn't having trouble reading it). Not a good policy, especially for a woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, friendly staff, warm cookies”
Reviews.Author: STLtravelSTL
Reviews.Content: The Champaign Hilton Garden Inn is one of the nicer Hilton Garden Inn's in which I have stayed. The front desk staff is always friendly and helpful (and offer warm cookies at check in). The room service (Great American Grill) is above average and arrived fast and hot. The fitness room is top-notch (several treadmills, bikes, free weights, and an eliptical machine- all with televisions built in). The rooms are larger than average and very clean. But best of all, the beds are wonderful-with lots of pillows, and comfortable double sheeting. If you are staying in the Champaign area, be sure to check out this hotel. For a mid-range hotel, it is certainly one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “clean, new feel, good location”
Reviews.Author: nycsf
Reviews.Content: much better location for town and univeristy visits than most local hotels (most are out by the highway/mall). very clean and new feeling. modern furniture and bedding is nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: bridgenut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Memorial weekend; travelled with a friend for a convention. Although we arrived at 1pm, they found a room with two beds and we checked in early. Room is very comfortable; nice furnishings and bed is great! This used to be the old Chancellor hotel and the remodelling has made a BIG difference! Nice bathroom, with hairdryer and toiletries. The room also has a fridge and microwave along with the other expected amenities. Bar, small restaurant area and seating area in the lobby, along with a small business centre - all very nice to look at and with comfortable seating. Indoor swimming pool with hot tub area and fitness centre. Free parking. I had a problem and needed to check out at 5pm - instead of staying another night as planned - and they were very understanding and didn't charge me for even late check-out. Clean facilites, helpful, friendly staff, comfortable accommodations - nuff said!

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on business recently. This is a classy joint. Friendly, professional front desk staff, clean, well-appointed rooms, great mattresses and linens--first rate from start to finish. My only complaint was the lack of soundproofing between rooms, something I expect of cheaper hotels. When my neighbor had a phone call at 6 a.m. I could hear him talking... but otherwise a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: swbrad
Reviews.Content: As expected, everything here is very nice and new. Very nice business center with 2 computers and printers, plus free wireless internet access. The pool looked rather small and was not ready for use yet. The location is great for university events. I didn't try the on-site restaurant as they had very limited food choices and closed at 9 PM. They also had a nice bar area, although I didn't find any of the staff very friendly. One thing if you stay here, be careful that your room door shuts completely, the new carpet tends to not allow the door to close on it's own. Nice HD TV in the room, just make sure to find the digital channels for the best picture.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & comfy”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelAlot
Reviews.Content: The New Hilton Garden in Champaign, Illinois is easy to drive to and just a few minutes from the University of Illinois Campus near both the Assembly Hall and Memorial Stadium. The staff was awesome...more than helpful, polite & courteous. The room was wonderful and it had a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a large TV. The king sized bed was verrrrry comfy, lots of pillows and was covered in luxorious linens. They also had a free business center and complimentary high speed internet access. The lobby & dining area are lovely and the food was delicious. There is also lots of close, free parking, a nice work-out room, pool and hot tub. The convention center is well laid out and I am looking forward to attending the Illinois PTA Convention here in April 2007.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Champaign/ Urbana
HotelInfo.Address: 1501 South Neil Street, Champaign, IL 61820 (Formerly Clarion)
